replies.body:
If I'm understanding you correctly, League froze on you and forced you to restart your PC after getting into the match? If this is correct, this is likely related to an issue with the new Windows Game Bar feature called *Game DVR* that was updated in the recent windows updates. I recommend disabling this feature using [this guide](http://www.tenforums.com/tutorials/8637-game-bar-turn-off-windows-10-a.html) to ensure this feature isn't causing your issue.

Let me know if this helped.

Hello,
I am assuming that you are saying that you were playing League of Legends and then your screen froze? If so try pressing Ctrl+alt+delete and then finding League of Legends in the task manager. Click on League of Legends and hit end task. If that doesn't work try Alt+tab and Alt+F4. If none of those work then hold down the power button on your computer until your computer powers off.
